chargeHist.descr: Possess THC with intent to deliver/use of dangerous weapon (>10,000 g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E. GUILMETTE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC with intent to deliver (>10,000 g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)5.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Execution of sentence is stayed and the defendant is placed on probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes transfer to Fond Du Lac County Jail.

Request and Response Re: Copy of JOC for Fond du Lac County DA

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction.
The court hereby orders that the judgment of conviction in this matter be amended as follows:  Court authorizes transfer to Sheboygan County Jail as long as Sheboygan County follows the same rules as Manitowoc County.

Sentencing Memorandum.
Letter from DA LaBre to Judge Fox.
(ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT)

Character letters from Mark Whitmore and Kathleen Kelliher.
Letter from defendant.

Plea/Sentencing hearing set for 04-15-2015 @ 11:00 a.m. BR-3
Rescheduled from 02-23-2015.

It is hereby ordered that the condition of bail that the defendant report to the Fond Du Lac County Sheriff's Department on a daily basis is hereby modified to require him to report on a weekly basis.  Specifically, the defendant is to report to the Fond Du Lac County Sheriff's Department on Mondays before 12:00 noon.  All of the other conditions of the defendant's bail remain as previously set.
Copy faxed to Fond Du Lac County Jail.

The court hereby orders that the application of the State for subpoenas made on or about September 15, 2014 along with all supporting documents shall be sealed until further order of the court.  In addiiton, the Court orders that the entry on CCAP regarding this transaction shall be removed until further order of the court.
Cover letter.

Defense counsel is requesting a modification of defendant's bail to be eliminated or reduced.  State has no objection to once a week report.  Court grants the motion and orders the defendant to report to the Fond du Lac Police Department each Monday by 12:00 p.m.  Plea date set for 02-23-14 at 10:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail.  
Cover Letter.
Plea hearing is reset to 11-18-14 at 1:30 p.m.

Subpoenas issued along with supporting documents.
(ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT ON 11-25-14)

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 09-23-2014 @ 3:30 p.m. BR-3.

Upon the court having ordered daily contact with law enforcement as a condition of bail and upon the court further ordering the defendant to reside in Fond du Lac County at the home of his parents, the conditions of the defendant's release are hereby modified to require the defendant to appear daily, prior to 4:00 p.m., at the Fond du Lac County Sheriff's Department rather than the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department as previously ordered.  The court is advised that the Fond du Lac County Sheriff's Department has agreed as a courtesy to provide this supervision service to the court.  The Fond du Lac County Sheriff's Department is advised that any violations by the defendant shall be reported in writing directly to the Manitowoc County District Attorney's Office.   
Cover Letter.

The Court grants the motion and modifies the bail to $15,000.00 cash with the same conditions.  The Court also adds a condition that the defendant must reside with his parents at W3426 Golf Course Drive, Fond Du Lac, WI 54937.

Minutes.
RE:  Possess THC with intent to deliver/use of dangerous weapon, on 06-06-14.
Affidavit of Investigator Andrew Beck, Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.
At 3:35 p.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC with intent to deliver and keeper of drug house.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-23-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $100,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the  Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he report daily to the Manitowoc County sheriff's Department by 4:00 p.m. and that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
